titleStmt.title: Frank Krebs and Pat Daughtery v. King County. Habeas Corpus Writ

bibl.title: Frank Krebs and Pat Daughtery v. King County. Habeas Corpus Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: R.M. Hopkins, Hes Hansen (unclear), J.H. Mc.Graw

div1.p: In the district court, Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the County of King. Habeas Corpus. The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of the King County Greeting: We command you, that you have the body of Frank Krebs by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Frank Krebs shall be called or charged, before the HON. Richard A Jones C H Hanford Judge of the aforesaid Court at at the Court room of the Court House on the 11th day of October 1889 on the hour of 130 oclock P.M. to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning him the said Frank Krebs And have you then and there this writ. WITNESS THE HON. C H Hanford RICHARD A. JONES Judge of said District Court, and the seal therof this 10th day of Oct A.D. 1889. RM Hopkins Clerk. Hes Hansen Deputy Clerk.

I do hereby return to Hon. C. H. Hanford Chief Justice of Washington Territory. That before the coming to me of the within writ, the said Frank Krebs was committed to my custody, and is detained by virtue of another writ, a copy of which is hereto accused, the original of which I also herewith produce, nevertheless I have the body of the said Frank Krebs before you at the day and place within mentioned, as I am within commanded. Dated at Seattle the 11th day of October 1889. Sheriff Service Copy Writ Travel Return Tax $1.00 .80 . 20. 50 / $2.50 J. H. McGraw Sheriff. Subscribed and from to before me this 11th day of October 1889

No. 7306 In the District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle, W.T. In the Matter of the Application of Pat Daugherty and Frank Krebs For Writ of Habeas Corpus. HABEAS CORPUS. Returned and filed this 11 day of Oct A.D. 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. Hes Hansen Deputy Clerk.
